task.title: Importing Excel data to a table

context.p: XSLT-Conref allows you to import Excel data to DITA files. Excel supports an XML format that stores data and formatting information. The Excel XML data is included with the xcr:source attribute. The script import-excel-xml-to-table.xsl inserts the Excel XML data into a DITA simpletable.

The first row of the Excel table is interpreted as table header. The number of simpletable columns corresponds to the number of entries in the first row of the Excel table. In the XSLT script, the attribute xml:space is set to "preserve" to enable line breaks within a table cell of the simpletable.
